intro: Trachelospermum dunnii, commonly known as the Hawaiian jasmine, is a flowering plant native to Hawaii. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant has opposite, simple, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. Trachelospermum dunnii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates.
